newsitem.title: USA: Virginia surplus could reach $200 million for '97.
newsitem.headline: Virginia surplus could reach $200 million for '97.

text.p: Virginia will have a surplus of $150 million to $200 million for the year that ends June 30, state Finance Secretary Ronald Tillet said.

Tillet told the House Appropriations Committee on Monday that state revenue growth for the first 11 months of fiscal 1997 was 8 percent, or 2.6 percentage points above projections. He attributed the increase to the state's strong economy.
The final total for the surplus should be known by mid-July, Tillet said. By law, half the surplus must go into the state's rainy day fund.
